subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Direct Recording...anyone, yet?  STEVE
author: bruce halliday

LC,
 
I don't directly record from any box that I use
for the simple reaso=
n that I want to hear the live responses from the box
in real time.
 
this =
can be achieved using a splitter with the main end connected to the 
box an=
d then connecting a dvr to one input and a speaker or headphones to the oth=
er.
 
I personally do not like to hook anything up to the box also because =
I believe that any other device
that is hooked into the box directly can in=
terfere or even dampen the signal being received.
 
But I guess the main re=
ason is, the way I do and record a session is the way I learned too
and it'=
s hard to teach an old dog new tricks.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups.comFrom: lcdupla@...: Sun, 20 Jan 2008 01:29:16 +00=
00Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Direct Recording...anyone, yet? STEVE

g sound, hiss and > > > ambient > > > > > noise -> > > > > > > > > > > > > =
not as clear as direct recording a session (I would > assume).> > > > > > >=

LC,<BR>
 <BR>
I don't directly record from any box that I =
use<BR>
for the simple reason that I want to hear the live responses from t=
he box<BR>
in real time.<BR>
 <BR>
this can be achieved using a splitt=
er with the main end connected to the <BR>
box and then connecting a dvr to=
 one input and a speaker or headphones to the other.<BR>
 <BR>
I perso=
nally do not like to hook anything up to the box also because I believe tha=
t any other device<BR>
that is hooked into the box directly can interfere o=
r even dampen the signal being received.<BR>
 <BR>
But I guess the mai=
n reason is, the way I do and record a session is the way I learned too<BR>=

and it's hard to teach an old dog new tricks.<BR>
 <BR>
Bruce<BR><BR>=
